title: Politics to weigh more heavily on ag markets: CBA
summary: Geopolitics, trade policy and government intervention are set to play a defining role in agricultural markets in the year ahead, according to CBA's 2026 Agri Commodities Outlook.

title: Cargill submits plans for 1.1Mt WA crush plant
summary: Public consultation has opened on Cargill’s Project Crux, which plans to crush 1.1Mt of WA canola per annum next to CBH’s Kwinana Grain Terminal.

title: People on the Move in the grain industry
summary: Who is on the move in the Australian grain industry? Catch up with our latest update on industry appointments, rewards and achievements…..

title: Feedgrain Focus: Prices rally on dry, slow grower selling
summary: Supplementary livestock feeding and a lack of grower selling has put some heat into eastern Australian feedgrain markets this week.

title: South Coast systems help WA handle record harvest
summary: Two vast WA cropping operations have cleared the high-moisture hurdle by developing their own grain-handling systems that supercharge their ability to outturn to CBH.

title: Daily Market Wire 22 January 2026
summary: Corn and beans strength supported wheat which slipped later in the session. WA softens, eastern wheat steadies.

title: Cropping gains 933,000ha at pastures’ expense: DAS
summary: Mixed-farming, high-rainfall, and irrigation areas have accounted for much of the 900,000ha shift from pastures to cropping seen by DAS in the past two years.

title: WA panel approves Perth oat mill despite initial objections
summary: Swan Milling P&E's plans to build an oat mill in Perth are inching forward to support the interests of a diverse group of shareholders.

title: Uncontained WA fire reaches into farmland
summary: Two fires west of Esperance have burnt more than 80,000ha of mostly bushland, although some farmland has been affected, and one farm dwelling has been lost.

title: Aus exports 912,990t barley, 29,910t sorghum in Nov
summary: Australia exported 912,990t of barley and 29,910t of sorghum in Nov, according to the latest ABS data.

title: Saga Robotics bets big on US vineyards with new GM, fresh capital for UV-C ‘bots: ‘Chemical free winegrowing is the holy grail’
summary:
During the 2025 California wine grape season, Saga Robotics increased treated acreage tenfold and expects to nearly triple it again in 2026.
